abstract: Family of Junior Seau, former NFL linebacker who suffered from chronic traumatic encephalopathy and committed suicide in 2012, says Seau's daugther Sydney should be able to speak at her father's induction into Pro Football Hall of Fame; current policy does not allow family members to deliver live remarks on behalf of deceased inductees.
lead_paragraph: The family said that contrary to reports, it did not support the Hall’s policy preventing relatives from speaking at a deceased player’s induction ceremony.

headline.main: Junior Seau’s Family Renews Call for Daughter to Speak at Hall of Fame
headline.print_headline: Seau Family Renews Call to Speak at Ceremony

snippet: The family said that contrary to reports, it did not support the Hall’s policy preventing relatives from speaking at a deceased player’s induction ceremony.
